org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.audio

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.audio.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages playback of audio from a file. Simply place an audio file in Team9202HME/res/raw, and then use R.raw.{file_name} as the Android resource ID. Be sure to import the correct R class, there are multiple.
    Author:
    Nathaniel Glover

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sound() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isLoaded()
      Checks whether or not the sound has been properly loaded and initialized
      boolean isLooping()
      Checks if looping is enabled
      boolean isPlaying()
      Tells whether the sound is currently playing.
      void load(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap, int resourceId)
      Loads the audio data from a file, accessed through an Android resource ID.
      void pause()
      Stops playing the sound until play() is called again
      void play()
      Plays the sound on a separate thread
      void setLooping(boolean looping)
      Enables or disables looping
      void setVolume(float leftVolume, float rightVolume)
      Sets the volume of the sound for both left and right speakers, if possible
      void stop()
      Completely stops the sound.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound()

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap,
                 int resourceId)
        Loads the audio data from a file, accessed through an Android resource ID. This function must be called before any other, and is usually done so in TeleOpProgram.init() or in the beginning of AutonomousProgram.run()
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - Is used to get a handle to the FTC Robot Controller app, so sound can be played through it
        resourceId - The Android resource ID for the audio file to be played

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the sound on a separate thread

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Tells whether the sound is currently playing. Note that this function's output may not update immediately after the sound has stopped playing, but it probably will (according to Android documentation anyways)
        Returns:
        Whether or not the sound is currently playing

      • setLooping

        public void setLooping(boolean looping)
        Enables or disables looping
        Parameters:
        looping - Whether or not to loop the sound

      • isLooping

        public boolean isLooping()
        Checks if looping is enabled
        Returns:
        Whether or not looping is enabled

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float leftVolume,
                      float rightVolume)
        Sets the volume of the sound for both left and right speakers, if possible
        Parameters:
        leftVolume - The left volume, from 0.0 to 1.0
        rightVolume - The right volume, from 0.0 to 1.0

      • pause

        public void pause()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops playing the sound until play() is called again
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Completely stops the sound. Calling play() will restart the sound
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Checks whether or not the sound has been properly loaded and initialized
        Returns:
        Whether or not the sound has been loaded
